fields.name: Apple___Apple_scab
fields.description: Apple scab is a common fungal disease that affects apple trees, caused by the fungus Venturia inaequalis. This disease can significantly impact the quality and yield of apple crops.

fields.name: Apple___Black_rot
fields.description: Black rot is a serious fungal disease that affects apples and other fruit trees, caused by the fungus Botryosphaeria obtusa. This disease can cause significant damage to leaves, fruit, and twigs, leading to substantial losses in apple orchards.

fields.name: Apple___Cedar_apple_rust
fields.description: Apple cedar rust is a fungal disease caused by the fungus Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae. It affects apple trees and eastern red cedar trees, leading to yellow-orange spots on leaves and fruit.

fields.name: Corn(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot_Gray_leaf_spot
fields.description: Cercospora leaf spot, also known as gray leaf spot, is caused by the fungus Cercospora zeae-maydis. It results in gray to tan lesions on corn leaves, potentially reducing photosynthetic activity and yield.

fields.name: Corn(maize)___Common_rust
fields.description: Common rust in corn is caused by the fungus Puccinia sorghi. This disease presents as reddish-brown pustules on both leaf surfaces and can reduce photosynthetic capability and yield.

fields.name: Corn(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight
fields.description: Northern Leaf Blight, caused by the fungus Exserohilum turcicum, appears as long, gray-green lesions on corn leaves, which can lead to significant yield losses if not managed.

fields.name: Grape___Black_rot
fields.description: Grape black rot is a fungal disease caused by Guignardia bidwellii. It affects grape leaves, shoots, and berries, resulting in black lesions and potentially severe crop loss.

fields.name: Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles)
fields.description: Esca, also known as black measles, is a complex fungal disease affecting grapevines, caused by multiple pathogens. Symptoms include leaf striping, berry shriveling, and wood necrosis.

fields.name: Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spot)
fields.description: Grape leaf blight, caused by the fungus Pseudocercospora vitis, results in dark, necrotic lesions on leaves, reducing photosynthesis and potentially impacting grape yield and quality.

fields.name: Potato___Early_blight
fields.description: Potato early blight, caused by the fungus Alternaria solani, leads to concentric ring lesions on leaves and stems, weakening plants and reducing tuber yield.

fields.name: Potato___Late_blight
fields.description: Potato late blight, caused by the oomycete Phytophthora infestans, is a devastating disease that causes dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves and stems, and can rot tubers in the field or storage.

fields.name: Tomato___Bacterial_spot
fields.description: Tomato bacterial spot, caused by Xanthomonas species, manifests as small, water-soaked spots on leaves, stems, and fruit, leading to defoliation and reduced fruit quality.

fields.name: Tomato___Early_blight
fields.description: Tomato early blight, caused by Alternaria solani, results in dark, concentric lesions on leaves and stems, which can lead to significant defoliation and yield loss.

fields.name: Tomato___Late_blight
fields.description: Tomato late blight, caused by Phytophthora infestans, causes dark, water-soaked lesions on foliage, stems, and fruit, often leading to rapid plant collapse and significant crop loss.

fields.name: Tomato___Leaf_Mold
fields.description: Tomato leaf mold, caused by the fungus Passalora fulva, results in yellow spots on the upper leaf surface and velvety, olive-green mold on the underside, reducing photosynthetic capacity.

fields.name: Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot
fields.description: Tomato septoria leaf spot, caused by the fungus Septoria lycopersici, appears as small, circular spots with dark borders on leaves, leading to defoliation and reduced fruit yield.

fields.name: Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider_mite
fields.description: Tomato spider mites, particularly Tetranychus species, cause stippling and yellowing of leaves as they feed on plant sap, potentially leading to leaf drop and reduced plant vigor.

fields.name: Tomato___Target_Spot
fields.description: Tomato target spot, caused by the fungus Corynespora cassiicola, results in brown lesions with concentric rings on leaves and fruit, leading to defoliation and fruit rot.

fields.name: Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus
fields.description: Tomato yellow leaf curl virus, transmitted by whiteflies, causes severe leaf curling, yellowing, and stunted growth, significantly impacting tomato yield and quality.

fields.name: Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus
fields.description: Tomato mosaic virus causes mottling, yellowing, and distortion of leaves, reducing photosynthesis and overall plant health, often leading to reduced fruit yield and quality.

fields.name: Tomato___healthy
fields.description: Healthy tomato plant.
